headline.main: Course in Italy Approved; Proposal to Withdraw Demand for Surrender Regarded as Ill-Advised

lead_paragraph: Charles Upson Clark, whose letter you published Aug. 27, while understanding the Italians, strangely does not seem to understand how thoroughly war is waged by the Germans. He believes: "The moment Mussolini gave way to Badoglio we should have dropped our unconditional surrender demand and given him immediate aid as a fighting ally to expel the Germans in cooperation with us."
abstract: Reply to lr on US policy toward Italy
